issues.problem: Default value set to datetime.utcnow() with parentheses
issues.cause: Calling datetime.utcnow() at import time evaluates to a fixed datetime; SQLAlchemy stores that value as default for all rows
issues.recommendation: Use default=datetime.utcnow (pass the callable) so the function is executed at insertion time

issues.cause: user_id declared as plain Integer so DB and ORM don't enforce referential integrity
issues.recommendation: Declare user_id = db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('user.id'), nullable=False) to enforce relationship

issues.cause: Relationship was one-directional; Post had no attribute to resolve its User instance via attribute access
issues.recommendation: Use db.relationship('Post', backref='author', lazy='dynamic') on User so Post.author resolves

notes: Tests added to validate timestamp auto-population and relationship resolution. Use provided run_test.ps1 on Windows.
